content: True friends stab you in the front.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: Life is so constructed that an event does not, cannot, will not, match the expectation.
author: Charlotte Brontë

content: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
author: Laozi

content: A passion for politics stems usually from an insatiable need, either for power, or for friendship and adulation, or a combination of both.
author: Fawn M. Brodie

content: When the world is so complicated, the simple gift of friendship is within all of our hands.
author: Maria Shriver
Wayne Gretzky
content: A good hockey player plays where the puck is. A great hockey player plays where the puck is going to be.
Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
author: Harriet Tubman

content: Imagination is the highest kite one can fly.
author: Lauren Bacall

content: Reality leaves a lot to the imagination.
author: John Lennon
The Buddha
content: When watching after yourself, you watch after others. When watching after others, you watch after yourself.
A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong gives it a superficial appearance of being right.
author: Thomas Paine
Erma Bombeck
content: If a man watches three football games in a row, he should be declared legally dead.

author: Alan Watts
content: Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.
If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

content: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
author: Bernard Shaw
The Buddha
content: Give, even if you only have a little.
Instead of saying that man is the creature of circumstance, it would be nearer the mark to say that man is the architect of circumstance.
author: Thomas Carlyle

content: With every experience, you alone are painting your own canvas, thought by thought, choice by choice.
author: Oprah Winfrey

content: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.
author: Bruce Lee

content: People are not lazy. They simply have impotent goals - that is, goals that do not inspire them.
author: Tony Robbins

content: Know what's important and what isn't. Have the wisdom to know the right thing to do, the integrity to do it, the character to stand up to those who don't, and the courage to stop those who won't.
author: Mark Goulston

content: Creativity comes from trust. Trust your instincts. And never hope more than you work.
author: Rita Mae Brown

content: I cannot always control what goes on outside. But I can always control what goes on inside.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: What matters is the value we've created in our lives, the people we've made happy and how much we've grown as people.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

content: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.
author: Cicero

content: Step with care and great tact and remember that Life's a Great Balancing Act.
author: Dr. Seuss

content: Arriving at one point is the starting point to another.
author: John Dewey

content: It has never been my object to record my dreams, just to realize them.
author: Man Ray

content: What we think determines what happens to us, so if we want to change our lives, we need to stretch our minds.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: I always wanted to be somebody, but I should have been more specific.
author: Lily Tomlin

content: Love is rarer than genius itself. And friendship is rarer than love.
author: Charles Péguy

content: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
author: Chuck Swindoll

content: The best way to pay for a lovely moment is to enjoy it.
author: Richard Bach

content: The winner ain't the one with the fastest car it's the one who refuses to lose.
author: Dale Earnhardt

content: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
author: Isaac Asimov

content: Once a new technology rolls over you, if you're not part of the steamroller, you're part of the road.
author: Stewart Brand

content: Never, never, never give up.
author: Winston Churchill

content: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.
author: Galileo Galilei

content: The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness.
author: Laozi

content: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
author: Seneca the Younger

content: Whatever we expect with confidence becomes our own self-fulfilling prophecy.
author: Brian Tracy

content: Appreciation can make a day, even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is necessary.
author: Margaret Cousins

content: The sum of wisdom is that time is never lost that is devoted to work.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Michael Jordan
content: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach him how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
author: Laozi

content: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

content: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.
author: Jim Rohn

content: The things that one most wants to do are the things that are probably most worth doing.
author: Winifred Holtby

content: For everything that lives is holy, life delights in life.
author: William Blake

content: I never considered a difference of opinion in politics, in religion, in philosophy, as cause for withdrawing from a friend.
author: Thomas Jefferson
